column2: Html Content / Article Extractor in Scala - open sourced from Gravity Labs

column5: message

Merge pull request #58 from aurality/upstream

Use line.separator to split Stopwords
raising our version to 2.1.22
MAJOR: The changes included in this were made to significantly decrease the number of exceptions thrown as well as increase overall performance with image detection.
Fixed backwards compatibility
Added the ability to completely override the object responsible for retrieving HTML content for goose to parse.

Use line.separator from sys.props for newline

Windows converts new lines to \n\r, but the split() is done on "\n" so
all stopwords have a carraige return at the end and all tests fail since
none of the words are matched.
Somehow having the generic scala.collection._ import cause an java.lang.AbstractMethodError for a call to Set.empty[String]. This removes the wildcard to fix it.
Issue #56 - Content not extracted from "article" tag: Adding 'article' as a possible root element for article content
Now the ImageUtils.fetchEntity will also wrap inner exceptions with the image source (URL) for better logging.

Tightened up our usage of the apache http commons lib by replacing deprecated calls and removed the default request retries from 3 to 0.

Also added a little more improved logging on errors so that the URL should always be written for any exception during a crawl
New version 2.1.15 now includes better error logging and configuable time outs

Adding ability to label common css selectors that should contain the main image we're looking for. This is handy to get near 100% accuracy on image fetching from major sites.

closes #24
MAJOR - Refactored the whole way all the Divs are initially scrubbed in the system. This fixes the issue of janksters who do not use Paragraphs to separate text, so we have to rebuild the text while keeping the stucture in place.
MAJOR - Upgrading the Image Extractor, refactoring the whole image downloading process including improving performance of re-using already downloaded file information.

Resolving goofy maven issue. it required a new version to fully update.

Major: DefaultOutputFormatter#getFormattedText now unescapes HTML including all HTML Entities

Minor: I have begun to convert the usage of DefaultOutputFormatter so that you only use a single method: getFormattedText(Element topNode)

Bug fixes:
  * clean by class name was too restrictive and removed actual content elements, modified the list of names to only remove classes
    that end in "meta" instead of just containing the word "meta"

  * Modified DefaultDocumentCleaner#cleanBadTags to only select from within the body element to avoid removing it.

  * Added a helper method for removing nodes to handle cases where the node's parentNode is null (already removed). This was previously
    throwing an IllegalArgumentException from within jSoup and thus failing the extraction.

Merge pull request #16 from erraggy/master

Time for Publish Date Extraction Maverick!
extended goose to provide the ability to extract article publish dates and provided a simple example within GoldSitesTest#testWired

Merge pull request #15 from erraggy/master

NEW & Improved! Now with TAGS! -- pull request take two...

exteded goose to also extract an article's tags by matching any element with "a[rel=tag], a[href*=/tag/]" and collecting only the unique set of text nodes from those elements. This version is still not ready for primetime as it is collecting tags outside of the actual article's boundaries. The content extraction process still needs more refactoring to allow this to be constrained only to a close perimeter of the topnode and not stray too far.

Merge pull request #12 from erraggy/master

Removed the last static Matcher that would cause infreaquent bugs in multithreaded environments

Removed last remaining static Matcher from source and replaced it with a static Pattern object. Also refactored the GoldSitesTest.java to make it easier to add new tests as well as identify exactly what failed if any failures do occur.
